problem_names:
lemma actPres:
  fixes P :: ccs
  and   Q :: ccs
  and   \<alpha> :: act

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "\<alpha>.(P) \<sim> \<alpha>.(Q)"

lemma sumPres:
  fixes P :: ccs
  and   Q :: ccs
  and   R :: ccs

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "P \<oplus> R \<sim> Q \<oplus> R"

lemma parPres:
  fixes P :: ccs
  and   Q :: ccs
  and   R :: ccs

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "P \<parallel> R \<sim> Q \<parallel> R"

lemma resPres: 
  fixes P :: ccs
  and   Q :: ccs
  and   x :: name

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "\<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P \<sim> \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q"

lemma bangPres: 
  fixes P :: ccs
  and   Q :: ccs

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "!P \<sim> !Q"
translations:
lemma actPres:
  fixes P :: ccs
  and   Q :: ccs
  and   \<alpha> :: act

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "\<alpha>.(P) \<sim> \<alpha>.(Q)"

proof (state)
this:
  (\<alpha>.P, \<alpha>.Q) \<in> {(\<alpha>.P, \<alpha>.Q) |P Q. P \<sim> Q}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<alpha>.P \<sim> \<alpha>.Q
by(coinduct rule: bisimCoinduct) (auto dest: bisimE intro: actPres)

lemma sumPres:
  fixes P :: ccs
  and   Q :: ccs
  and   R :: ccs

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "P \<oplus> R \<sim> Q \<oplus> R"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<oplus> R \<sim> Q \<oplus> R

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<oplus> R \<sim> Q \<oplus> R
let ?X = "{(P \<oplus> R, Q \<oplus> R) | P Q R. P \<sim> Q}"

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<oplus> R \<sim> Q \<oplus> R

proof (state)
this:
  (P \<oplus> R, Q \<oplus> R)
  \<in> {(P \<oplus> R, Q \<oplus> R) |P Q R. P \<sim> Q}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<oplus> R \<sim> Q \<oplus> R
by(coinduct rule: bisimCoinduct) (auto intro: sumPres reflexive dest: bisimE)

proof (state)
this:
  P \<oplus> R \<sim> Q \<oplus> R

goal:
No subgoals!

lemma parPres:
  fixes P :: ccs
  and   Q :: ccs
  and   R :: ccs

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "P \<parallel> R \<sim> Q \<parallel> R"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<parallel> R \<sim> Q \<parallel> R

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<parallel> R \<sim> Q \<parallel> R
let ?X = "{(P \<parallel> R, Q \<parallel> R) | P Q R. P \<sim> Q}"

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<parallel> R \<sim> Q \<parallel> R

proof (state)
this:
  (P \<parallel> R, Q \<parallel> R)
  \<in> {(P \<parallel> R, Q \<parallel> R) |P Q R. P \<sim> Q}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<parallel> R \<sim> Q \<parallel> R
by(coinduct rule: bisimCoinduct, auto) (blast intro: parPres dest: bisimE)+

proof (state)
this:
  P \<parallel> R \<sim> Q \<parallel> R

goal:
No subgoals!

lemma resPres: 
  fixes P :: ccs
  and   Q :: ccs
  and   x :: name

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "\<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P \<sim> \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q"
let ?X = "{(\<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P, \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q) | x P Q. P \<sim> Q}"

proof (prove)
using this:
  P \<sim> Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P, \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q)
    \<in> {(\<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P, \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q) |x P Q.
           P \<sim> Q}

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P, \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q)
  \<in> {(\<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P, \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q) |x P Q.
         P \<sim> Q}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P \<sim> \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q

proof (prove)
using this:
  (\<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P, \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q)
  \<in> {(\<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P, \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q) |x P Q.
         P \<sim> Q}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P \<sim> \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q
by(coinduct rule: bisimCoinduct) (auto intro: resPres dest: bisimE)

lemma bangPres: 
  fixes P :: ccs
  and   Q :: ccs

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "!P \<sim> !Q"

proof (prove)
using this:
  P \<sim> Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (!P, !Q) \<in> bangRel bisim

proof (state)
this:
  (!P, !Q) \<in> bangRel bisim

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. !P \<sim> !Q

proof (prove)
using this:
  (!P, !Q) \<in> bangRel bisim

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. !P \<sim> !Q

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim \<Longrightarrow>
       P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q
 2. \<And>P Q.
       (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim \<Longrightarrow>
       (Q, P) \<in> bangRel bisim

proof (state)
this:
  (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim \<Longrightarrow>
       P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q
 2. \<And>P Q.
       (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim \<Longrightarrow>
       (Q, P) \<in> bangRel bisim

proof (chain)
picking this:
  (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim

proof (prove)
using this:
  (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<And>P Q. P \<sim> Q \<Longrightarrow> !P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] !Q
 2. \<And>R T P Q.
       \<lbrakk>R \<sim> T; (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim;
        P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> R \<parallel>
                         P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] T \<parallel> Q

proof (state)
this:
  P \<sim> Q

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<And>P Q. P \<sim> Q \<Longrightarrow> !P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] !Q
 2. \<And>R T P Q.
       \<lbrakk>R \<sim> T; (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim;
        P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> R \<parallel>
                         P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] T \<parallel> Q

proof (state)
this:
  P \<sim> Q
  ?P \<sim> ?Q \<Longrightarrow> ?P \<leadsto>[bisim] ?Q

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<And>P Q. P \<sim> Q \<Longrightarrow> !P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] !Q
 2. \<And>R T P Q.
       \<lbrakk>R \<sim> T; (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim;
        P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> R \<parallel>
                         P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] T \<parallel> Q

proof (prove)
using this:
  P \<sim> Q
  ?P \<sim> ?Q \<Longrightarrow> ?P \<leadsto>[bisim] ?Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. !P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] !Q

proof (state)
this:
  !P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] !Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>R T P Q.
       \<lbrakk>R \<sim> T; (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim;
        P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> R \<parallel>
                         P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] T \<parallel> Q

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>R T P Q.
       \<lbrakk>R \<sim> T; (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim;
        P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> R \<parallel>
                         P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] T \<parallel> Q

proof (state)
this:
  R \<sim> T
  (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim
  P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>R T P Q.
       \<lbrakk>R \<sim> T; (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim;
        P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> R \<parallel>
                         P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] T \<parallel> Q

proof (prove)
using this:
  R \<sim> T

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. R \<leadsto>[bisim] T

proof (state)
this:
  R \<leadsto>[bisim] T

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>R T P Q.
       \<lbrakk>R \<sim> T; (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim;
        P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> R \<parallel>
                         P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] T \<parallel> Q

proof (state)
this:
  R \<leadsto>[bisim] T

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>R T P Q.
       \<lbrakk>R \<sim> T; (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim;
        P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> R \<parallel>
                         P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] T \<parallel> Q
note \<open>R \<sim> T\<close> \<open>P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q\<close> \<open>(P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim\<close> bangRel.BRPar

proof (state)
this:
  R \<sim> T
  P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q
  (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim
  \<lbrakk>(?R, ?T) \<in> ?Rel; (?P, ?Q) \<in> bangRel ?Rel\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> (?R \<parallel> ?P, ?T \<parallel> ?Q)
                    \<in> bangRel ?Rel

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>R T P Q.
       \<lbrakk>R \<sim> T; (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim;
        P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> R \<parallel>
                         P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] T \<parallel> Q

proof (chain)
picking this:
  R \<leadsto>[bisim] T
  R \<sim> T
  P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q
  (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim
  \<lbrakk>(?R, ?T) \<in> ?Rel; (?P, ?Q) \<in> bangRel ?Rel\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> (?R \<parallel> ?P, ?T \<parallel> ?Q)
                    \<in> bangRel ?Rel

proof (prove)
using this:
  R \<leadsto>[bisim] T
  R \<sim> T
  P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q
  (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim
  \<lbrakk>(?R, ?T) \<in> ?Rel; (?P, ?Q) \<in> bangRel ?Rel\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> (?R \<parallel> ?P, ?T \<parallel> ?Q)
                    \<in> bangRel ?Rel

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. R \<parallel> P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] T \<parallel> Q

proof (state)
this:
  R \<parallel> P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] T \<parallel> Q

goal:
No subgoals!

proof (state)
this:
  P \<leadsto>[bangRel bisim] Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim \<Longrightarrow>
       (Q, P) \<in> bangRel bisim

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim \<Longrightarrow>
       (Q, P) \<in> bangRel bisim

proof (state)
this:
  (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim \<Longrightarrow>
       (Q, P) \<in> bangRel bisim

proof (prove)
using this:
  (P, Q) \<in> bangRel bisim

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (Q, P) \<in> bangRel bisim
by induct (auto dest: bisimE intro: BRPar BRBang)

proof (state)
this:
  (Q, P) \<in> bangRel bisim

goal:
No subgoals!
